column2: Jennifer Connelly
column3: Djimon Hounsou;"It is 1999 and Sierra Leone is ravaged by major political unrest. Rebel factions such as the Revolutionary United Front frequently terrorize the countryside
column4: intimidating Mende locals and enslaving many to harvest diamonds
column5: which fund their increasingly successful war effort. One such unfortunate local is fisherman Solomon Vandy (Djimon Hounsou) from Shenge

column1: One morning

column3: but the area is suddenly raided by government troops. Vandy buries the stone before being captured. Both Vandy and Poison are incarcerated in Freetown
column4: along with Danny Archer (Leonardo DiCaprio)
column5: a white Rhodesian gunrunner jailed while trying to smuggle diamonds into Liberia. They were intended for Rudolph van de Kaap (Marius Weyers)

column1: Hearing of the pink diamond in prison

column3: an Afrikaner formerly with the apartheid-era South African Defence Force

column5: but Coetzee wants it as compensation for Archer's botched smuggling mission. Archer returns to Sierra Leone
column6: locates Vandy
column7: and offers to help him find his family if he will help recover the diamond.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: RUF insurgents escalate hostilities; Freetown falls to their advance while Vandy's son Dia is among those rounded up to serve as a child soldier under a liberated Captain Poison. Archer and Vandy narrowly escape to Lungi
column3: where they plan to reach Kono with an American journalist
column4: Maddy Bowen (Jennifer Connelly); in exchange
column5: Archer will provide her evidence of the illicit diamond trade. The trio arrive in Kono after a harrowing journey

column1: While Maddy gets out with her story
column2: the two men set out for Captain Poison's encampment. Dia
column3: stationed with the RUF garrison there
column4: is confronted by Vandy
column5: but having been brainwashed he refuses to acknowledge his father. Archer radios the site's coordinates to Coetzee
column6: who directs a combined air and ground assault on the camp; Vandy finds Captain Poison and beats him to death with a shovel as the mercenaries overwhelm the RUF defenders. Coetzee then forces Vandy to produce the diamond
column7: but is killed by Archer
column8: who realizes Coetzee would eventually kill them both. Dia holds the pair briefly at gunpoint
column9: but Vandy confronts him again and renews their bond. Pursued by vengeful mercenaries

column12: who flies them to safety while Archer makes a final phone call to Maddy; they share final farewells as he asks her to assist Vandy

column1: Braveheart;USA;Action|Biography|Drama|History|War;Mel Gibson;Mhairi Calvey;Mel Gibson
column2: Sophie Marceau
column3: Catherine McCormack
column4: Patrick McGoohan;"In 1280

column14: but as she fights off their second attempt

column6: William Fichtner;"Libria
column7: a totalitarian city-state
column8: was established by the survivors of World War III
column9: where all emotions and emotionally stimulating objects have been forbidden as they are believed to have led to the war. The population suppresses all emotion by injecting themselves daily with ""Prozium II""
column10: and ""Sense Offenders"" –those who choose to experience unlawful emotions or possess objects likely to stimulate emotion– are put to death. Libria is governed by the Tetragrammaton Council
column11: led by ""Father""
column12: who is only seen on giant video screens throughout the city spreading propaganda messages. At the pinnacle of Librian law enforcement are the Grammaton Clerics
column13: trained in the martial art of gun kata. Clerics frequently raid properties in the city and the ""Nether"" -regions outside the city- to search for and destroy illegal materials (art
column14: literature
column15: and music) and execute the people hiding them. A resistance movement
column16: known as the ""Underground""
column17: emerges with the goal of toppling Father and the Tetragrammaton Council.

column2: John Preston is a high-ranking Cleric whose wife
column3: Viviana
column4: was executed as a Sense Offender
column5: leaving him a single father of his daughter and son. Following a raid
column6: Preston notices his partner
column7: Errol Partridge
column8: saves a book of poems instead of turning it in for incineration. After tracing Partridge to the Nether and finding him reading the book
column9: Partridge explains that he gladly pays the heavy price of feeling emotions; Preston executes him as he slowly reaches for his gun.

column1: Preston accidentally breaks his daily vial of Prozium but is unable to replace it before going on the next raid. He begins to experience brief episodes of emotion that evoke memories
column2: stir feelings
column3: and make him more aware of his surroundings; he intentionally skips more doses of Prozium and hides them behind the mirror in his bathroom.

column1: Partridge is replaced with career-conscious Brandt
column2: who expresses his admiration for Preston's ""uncompromising"" work as a cleric. On a raid
column3: they arrest Mary O'Brien
column4: a citizen identified as a Sense Offender. To Brandt's surprise
column5: Preston prevents him from executing O'Brien on the spot
column6: saying she should be kept alive for interrogation; he grows suspicious of Preston's hesitation to do his job completely. As Preston feels remorse for having killed Partridge
column7: he develops an emotional relationship with O'Brien and uncovers clues that lead to meeting Jurgen: the leader of the Underground resistance who plans to have Prozium production disrupted -to spark a populace uprising- and convinces Preston that Father must be assassinated.

column1: Vice-Counsel DuPont meets with Preston to reveal that there is a traitor in the upper ranks of the Clerics. Although DuPont appears to know it is Preston
column2: he assigns him the task of uncovering and stopping the traitor. Relieved
column3: Preston accepts and renews a promise to locate the Underground's leadership. O'Brien is set to be executed and Jurgen advises against interfering
column4: as it could sabotage plans for the revolution but
column5: unable to bear her death
column6: Preston still unsuccessfully tries to stop it. As he has an emotional breakdown in the streets
column7: Brandt arrests him and brings him before DuPont; however
column8: Preston tricks DuPont into believing that Brandt is the traitor. Following Brandt's arrest
column9: Preston is informed that a search of his home will take place as a formality. He rushes home to destroy the hidden vials
column10: only to find his son –who stopped taking Prozium after his mother died– already has.

column1: Jurgen has Preston capture the leaders of the resistance to gain the government's trust and get close enough to Father to assassinate him. As Preston is granted an exclusive audience with Father -really just a projection of Father-
column2: he discovers that Brandt was not actually arrested
column3: but was part of a ruse to expose Preston and the Underground. DuPont reveals that he is the real Father -having secretly replaced the original Father after his death- and that he does not take Prozium and can feel emotions. He taunts Preston
column4: asking how it felt to betray the Underground. Enraged
column5: Preston fights his way through an army of bodyguards to DuPont's office and kills Brandt in a katana battle. DuPont and Preston have a gun kata showdown; Preston wins and DuPont pleads for his life
column6: reminding Preston that he represents life and feeling and asks
column7: ""Is it really worth the price?"" Responding with Partridge's last words
column8: ""I pay it gladly""
column9: Preston kills DuPont. He destroys the command center that broadcasts the propaganda from Father; as the Underground carries out the destruction of Prozium manufacturing and storage facilities

column1: eXistenZ;Canada;Sci-Fi;David Cronenberg;Jennifer Jason Leigh;Jennifer Jason Leigh
column2: Jude Law
column3: Ian Holm;"In the near-future
column4: biotechnological virtual reality game consoles known as ""game pods"" have replaced electronic ones. The pods present ""UmbyCords"" that attach to ""bio-ports""
column5: connectors surgically inserted into players' spines . Two game companies
column6: Antenna Research and Cortical Systematics
column7: compete against each other. In addition
column8: a group of ""realists"" fights both companies to prevent the ""deforming"" of reality.

column1: Antenna Research's Allegra Geller (Jennifer Jason Leigh)
column2: a world renowned game designer
column3: is demonstrating her latest virtual reality game
column4: eXistenZ to a focus group at a seminar. A realist named Noel Dichter (Kris Lemche) shoots Allegra in the shoulder with an organic pistol he smuggled past security. As Dichter is gunned down by the security team
column5: security guard (and marketing trainee) Ted Pikul (Jude Law) rushes to Geller and escorts her outside.

column1: Geller discovers that her pod
column2: which contains the only copy of eXistenZ
column3: may have been damaged due to an ""UmbyCord"" being ripped out as the game was being downloaded. To check it
column4: she must plug into the game in tandem with another player she can trust. Allegra manages to convince an initially reluctant Pikul to have a bio-port installed
column5: and takes him to a gas station run by a black-marketeer named Gas (Willem Dafoe) to get it done. Gas deliberately installs a faulty bio-port
column6: which damages the game pod
column7: and reveals his intention to kill Geller for the bounty on her head. However
column8: Pikul shoots him with the rivet gun used to install the port
column9: and the pair make their way to a former ski lodge used by Geller's mentor
column10: Kiri Vinokur (Ian Holm). Vinokur and his assistant repair the damaged pod and give Pikul a new bio-port.

column1: Geller and Pikul enter the game
column2: and inside Pikul realizes that it is hard to tell whether their actions are their own intentions or the game's. When they meet D'Arcy Nader (Robert A. Silverman)
column3: a video game shop owner
column4: Pikul speaks rudely to him but then expresses surprise at his own rudeness
column5: which Geller informs that it was the doing of his game character. Nader gives them new micro pods to enter a new layer of virtual reality.

column1: Reality becomes more distorted as they gain newer identities as workers at a game pod factory. There
column2: they meet Yevgeny Nourish (Don McKellar)
column3: who claims to be their contact in the Realist underground. Nourish recommends that Pikul order the special for lunch at a Chinese restaurant near the factory. Once in the restaurant
column4: an overwhelmed Pikul pauses the game in order to temporarily get back to the real world
column5: but finds out that he is unable to distinguish the presumed reality from the game's fantasy. Back at the restaurant
column6: Pikul develops an urge to eat the unappetizing special

column8: Pikul almost automatedly constructs a pistol like the one used to shoot Geller
column9: which he uses to shoot their Chinese waiter (Oscar Hsu). In keeping with game parameters

column11: Rick Yune;"Former Army Ranger Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) is the lead U.S. Secret Service agent assigned to head the U.S. Presidential detail. Banning maintains a personal
column12: friendly relationship with President Benjamin Asher (Aaron Eckhart)

column15: but Margaret falls to her death while inside the car.

column1: Eighteen months later

column4: a North Korean terrorist organization
column5: led by Kang Yeonsak (Rick Yune)
column6: mounts an air and ground assault that results in the capture of the White House. The group is aided by treasonous members of the prime minister's own detail
column7: including Dave Forbes (Dylan McDermott)
column8: a former Secret Service agent. Asher and several top officials are held hostage in the White House bunker; South Korean Prime Minister Lee is executed on live video. Before his own death

column1: Kang seeks to use Asher's hostage status as leverage to force U.S. officials to withdraw the Seventh Fleet and U.S. forces from the Korean Peninsula
column2: thus removing American opposition to a North Korean invasion of South Korea. He also seeks to destroy the American nuclear weapons stockpile by detonating them in their respective silos across the country

column4: he requires the access codes to a system called Cerberus

column6: including the President
column7: all of whom are inside the bunker. Asher orders the other two officials to reveal their codes to save their lives
column8: certain that he will not give up his code.

column1: During the initial assault by Kang's forces
column2: Banning joins the White House's defenders. He falls back into the White House
column3: disabling the internal surveillance and gaining access to Asher's satellite ear phone
column4: which he uses to maintain contact with Jacobs and Speaker of the House Allan Trumbull (Morgan Freeman)
column5: now the Acting President.

column1: Authorized to proceed
column2: Banning’s first act is to save the President's son Connor
column3: whom Kang plans to use to force Asher to reveal his Cerberus code. Banning finds Connor hiding in the building's walls and sneaks the boy to safety. Banning then begins reconnaissance

column5: including Forbes. Meanwhile
column6: Army Chief of Staff General Edward Clegg (Robert Forster) convinces Trumbull to order an aerial SEAL assault on the White House. Kang discovers the assault force and activates the Hydra 6
column7: an advanced anti-aircraft system built by the military. Discovering the system

column9: but the new weapon system annihilates most of the assault force before Banning can stop it. Kang retaliates for the infiltration by killing Vice President Charlie Rodriguez (Phil Austin).

column1: After Banning disables Kang’s communications

column4: Kang fakes his and Asher's death by sacrificing several of his men and the remaining hostages. However
column5: Banning sees through the ruse. Kang eventually cracks Asher’s code using brute-force attack and activates Cerberus. As Kang and his remaining men attempt to escape
column6: Banning ambushes them and kills the remaining terrorists. During the fight

column8: in which Kang quickly gains the upper hand. Eventually

column1: During daybreak
column2: Banning walks out with Asher and is received by the soldiers posted to await their arrival. After the events

column7: Alfred Molina;"In 1936

column1: Jones returns to his teaching position at Marshall College

column3: Abner Ravenwood
column4: under whom Jones studied at the University of Chicago. The Nazis know that Ravenwood is the leading expert on the ancient city of Tanis in Egypt

column6: their armies will become invincible. The Staff of Ra is the key to finding the Well of Souls
column7: a secret chamber in which the Ark is buried.

column1: The agents authorize Jones to recover the Ark to prevent the Nazis from obtaining it. He travels to Nepal and discovers that Ravenwood has died
column2: and the headpiece is in the possession of Ravenwood's daughter Marion. Jones visits Marion at her tavern
column3: where she reveals her bitter feelings toward him from a previous romantic affair. She physically rebuffs his offer to buy the headpiece
column4: and Jones leaves. Shortly after
column5: a group of thugs arrive with their Nazi commander Arnold Toht. Toht threatens Marion to get the headpiece but Jones returns to the bar and fights the Nazis to save Marion. During the fight the bar is set ablaze and the headpiece lands in the flames. Toht severely burns his hand trying to take the hot headpiece and flees the tavern screaming. Jones and Marion escape with the headpiece
column6: and Marion decides to accompany Jones in his search for the Ark so he can repay his debt to her.

column1: The pair travels to Cairo
column2: where they meet up with Jones' friend and skilled digger Sallah. Sallah informs them that Belloq and the Nazis are digging for the Well of Souls with a replica of the headpiece (created from the scar on Toht's hand). They quickly realize the Nazi headpiece is incomplete and that the Nazis are digging in the wrong place. The Nazis kidnap Marion and it appears to Jones that she is killed in an exploding truck. After a confrontation with Belloq in a local bar
column3: Jones and Sallah infiltrate the Nazi dig site and use their staff to correctly locate the Ark. Jones discovers Marion is alive when he finds her bound and gagged in a tent. He refuses to release her out of fear of alerting the Nazis. Jones
column4: Sallah
column5: and a small group of diggers unearth the Well of Souls and acquire the Ark. Belloq and Nazi officer Colonel Dietrich arrive and seize the Ark from Jones
column6: throwing Marion into the Well of Souls with him before sealing it back up. Jones and Marion escape to a local airstrip
column7: where Jones has a fistfight with a Nazi mechanic and destroys the flying wing that was to transport the Ark to Berlin. The panicked Nazis remove the Ark in a truck and set off for Cairo
column8: but Jones catches them and retakes it. He makes arrangements to take the Ark to London aboard a tramp steamer.

Suddenly
column6: angelic ghost-like beings emerge from the Ark and Jones cautions Marion to keep her eyes closed and not to look no matter what happens. A vortex of flame forms above the Ark and shoots bolts of fiery energy into the gathered Nazi soldiers
column7: killing them all. As Belloq

column6: Eva Marie Saint;"For the previous five years

column8: journalist and past love Lois Lane wrote a scathing article ""Why the World Doesn't Need Superman""
column9: winning her the Pulitzer Prize. Lois is engaged to Richard White

column11: and with whom she shares a young asthmatic son

column1: Superman returns to Earth

column6: along with her son
column7: explores the yacht docked there. Discovering Luthor
column8: she is held captive as the yacht heads out into the Atlantic. Luthor plans to use the Kryptonian crystal technology Superman used to create his Fortress of Solitude to create a massive new continent which would swallow some of the current landmasses bordering the Atlantic. The world will then be forced to use his new land. Placing a crystal inside a shell of refined kryptonite
column9: Luthor triggers the new land growth by launching it into the sea.

column7: knocking Lois unconscious and sinking the yacht. Superman rescues them and gets them to the safety of Richard's plane.

column7: using the last of his strength

column1: Escaping with Luthor in the helicopter

column3: Michael Caine;"In 1879
column4: a communiqué from Lord Chelmsford to the Secretary of State for War in London (voice-over narration by Richard Burton) details the crushing defeat of a British force at the hands of the Zulus at the Battle of Isandlwana. In the aftermath of the battle
column5: the victorious Zulus walk amongst the scattered bodies of dead British soldiers and gather their rifles. At a mass Zulu marriage ceremony witnessed by missionary Otto Witt (Jack Hawkins) and his daughter (Ulla Jacobsson)
column6: Zulu King Cetewayo (Chief Mangosuthu Buthelezi) is also informed of the great victory.

column1: A company of the British Army's 24th Regiment of Foot is using the missionary station of Rorke's Drift in Natal as a supply depot and hospital for their invasion force across the border in Zululand. Receiving news of Isandhlwana from the Natal Native Contingent Commander Adendorff
column2: who warns that an army of 4
column3: 000 Zulu warriors is advancing to the British position
column4: Lieutenant John Chard (Stanley Baker) of the Royal Engineers assumes command of the small British detachment. Lieutenant Gonville Bromhead (Michael Caine)
column5: an infantry officer
column6: is rather put out to find himself subordinate to an engineer due to the latter's slightly earlier commission. Realising that they cannot outrun the Zulu army with wounded soldiers
column7: Chard decides to make a stand at the station
column8: using wagons
column9: sacks of mealie
column10: and crates of ship's biscuit to form a defensive perimeter to counter the Zulu nation's deadly effective Bull tactical enveloping formation. Witt becomes drunk and demoralises the men with his overtly dire predictions; the soldiers of the Natal Native Contingent desert. Chard orders Witt to be locked up in a supply room.

column1: As the Zulu impis approach
column2: a contingent of Boer horsemen arrives. They advise Chard that defending the station is hopeless. They retreat in haste
column3: despite Chard's desperate pleas for them to stay. The Zulu army approach and then charge. The British open fire
column4: but Adendorff informs them that the Zulus are only testing the British firepower. Witt again predicts the soldiers' inevitable fate
column5: before being driven from the battle with his daughter. Chard is concerned that the northern perimeter wall is undermanned and realises that the attack will come from all sides. The defenders are surprised when the Zulu warriors open fire on the station with rifles
column6: taken from the British dead at Isandlwana.

column1: Throughout the day and night
column2: wave after wave of Zulu attackers are repelled. The Zulus succeed in setting fire to the hospital
column3: leading to intense fighting between British patients and Zulu warriors as the former try to escape the flames. Private Henry Hook (James Booth) takes charge and successfully leads the patients to safety.

column1: The next morning
column2: the Zulus approach to within several hundred yards and begin singing a war chant; the British respond by singing ""Men of Harlech"". In the final assault
column3: just as it seems the Zulus will finally overwhelm the tired defenders
column4: the British soldiers fall back to a small redoubt constructed out of mealie bags. With a reserve of soldiers hidden within the redoubt
column5: they form into three ranks and seamlessly fire volley after volley
column6: inflicting heavy casualties; the Zulus withdraw. After a pause of three hours
column7: the defenders are still recovering when the Zulus re-form again on the Oscarberg. Resigned to another assault
column8: the British are astonished when the Zulus instead sing a song to honour the bravery of the defenders before departing.
